S.FORM: Masipulin, mukumbu’in tataqu’an ca tataqu, tupa ca pancang tu “minduldula, masumsuma.”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Matacqait ata bazbaz tupa tu “miqumicang tataqu.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: Uutu masipul tudiip, taqu’an azam tataqu malasbunun masipul is paitasanpia.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.

S.FORM: Malavi azam is tataqu silisili bazbaz, tusasauc azam is paitasanpia.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Madia’ sala ca pisqancaipunin zaku malasbunun a qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Bunun languages.

S.FORM: Daqdaqanin azak munsipulan, daqdaqanin azak pisqanciap malasbunun, na isbazbazku patan’a tina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Kaut ca ngaan naak.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Kaut。
My name is Kaut.

S.FORM: Abis ca ngaan it tama naak.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Abis。
My dad’s name is Abis.

S.FORM: Ival ca nggan it tina naak.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Ival。
My mother’s name is Ival.

S.FORM: Mac’an ca qamisan naak haip.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Maiza tatini tuqasnanaz naak, tupa’un tu Batu, mac’an qan ta’a ca qamisan cia haip.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Batu，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Batu, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Maszang ca sipulan naam.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Asa azak it tuqasnanaz naak tusasauc.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Asa azak tunhapav, maca mul’uun, na muskun azam tatlumaq tunhapav.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Asa azak papacqal’ is kaviaz, na maqtu’ azam muskun tusasauc ciin tunhapav.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: Uva’az azak is Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我是布農族的小孩。
I am an Bunun child.

S.FORM: Iha’an Ququaz ca lumaq naak.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在曲冰。
Our family lives in Ququaz.

S.FORM: Maiza azam hahima’ tatlumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Maiza azam tataau ka maitac’an.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Aluskunan azak tama, tina, tuqasnanaz ciin tuqasnau’az.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Malaungkav hala ca tama naak, sasaipuk ca tama naak.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Makius ca tina naak, ising ca tina naak.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: Malasbunun ca tama pababazbaz zamun ca ilumaq.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: Maca mul’uun tanabal a mu’amin azam mun’acang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Muskun azak it tuqas naak madamus ciciuq.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Mantan azak asa salas tatlumaq naam.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Muskun azak tina munata’ kavivila’ haip.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Masanglav sala ca diqanin, nii’ tu maci’it, nii’ amin macaklu ca diqanin, makazhav sala ca hivhiv.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Mal’anugqu’ azam is muut ma’us pang, savali’an azam is vali, maklang sala tan’aun.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Mina’unin tu qani’an, mindangqac ca diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Macingav azak tina tu, makua ca diqanin cuna mindangqac.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Tupa ca tina tu, qaal na maiza ca luvluv.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Uka’ is luhum tu sananvan, mintasal ca bintuqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Na mulumaqin azam amin.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Kamicqang is daan tu na mulumaq, masisaupa bintuqan ca is’ang min’asaz.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Ka’ang qa ca luvluv mindaduu maipa ti’, asang azak munata’ kavivila’.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: Ingalan is lumaq naam ca sipulan, daqdaqanin azak tan’anak munsipulan, tan’anak amin mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Nii’ tu madaing ca sipulan naak, nii’ tu madia’ ca masisipul, mu’amin papanqal.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Mu’amin ca masisipul mu’inun ha’an vangku, muskun pakamali’, muskun pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Muskun amin zamun ca tataqu kavivila’, maitatlumaq ca sipulani’.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Daqdaqanin azam ma’asik, mu’amin siningzav is taququ’anin maqaisvaz.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Maiza ca maqaisqais is taungkul, maiza ca ma’asik.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Ma’asik azam amin ciki’ciki’ is sipulan, aminun paqusil pakadangaz ca kukuzaun, daqdaqanin maningzav sala ca sipulan.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Mun’acang azak tantungu ha’an qudasnanaz takna.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Talbuntun azam nii’ tu pasaduu, mantan azak min’asaz cia.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Saduun zakun at qudas a, musuu’ paka’un zakun sikua, paquu’ zakun savil.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Mantan madavuc ca sikua sincuaz it qudasnanaz, mantan macial kaunun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Mazima azak savil it qudasnanaz, macial amin quu’an.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: Uutu tustusvalin, musku azak it qudasnau’az pitdia paitu qani’an.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Malcikaupata’ ca sinhanat it qudasnau’az a paitu qani’an, maiza ca kaan, tulkuk, bahat, maiza amin ca qazuqazu’.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Mina’unin is paitu qani’an a, munha’an azam pinsanglavan matinguc is sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Madia’ sala ca siniza’ it qudasnau’az a hutan, taii’ ciin calu iscaiv zakun, na ispa’adas zakun mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: Pasumsum azak nai tu mudaan, taqu tu na muqna’ang tantungu nai’an ca ickuin.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: Adasun azam tataqu munha’an patismumuutan haip diqanin, iha’an azam ukumbu’an masindailaz mabaliv is kipu’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Mukumbu’in azam is patismumuutan a, tupa ca tataqu tu “luqai’ ca ha’an tantangaus, ivut ca ha’an hiku’, ananaka saduu.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: Mapising azak is ivut, daqat nii’ azak saduus ivutivut.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Madia’ sala ca luqai’ sadu’anku, idaza’ a nais lukic kusbabai, saduu azak amin tucqu’ ikumbu’ is huqtung masabaq.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Maiza ca cuu’, tancikis, ciin huqnavdaing iha’an patismumuutan, mii’ang azak qabas sinaduus tismumuut mangki’, sinaduun azak haip a manahip sala ca is’ang.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Madia’ sala ca siniza’ inaak a qaningu, iscaiv it tamatina pasaduu nai.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Na muskun azak it tamatina maipa ti’ maca muqnin.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Iha’an inul’uan dii, muskun azak it tuqasnau’az muntaitu’ ha’an pantamaun naak tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪我的叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Minaha’an azam Taihuku’ tunlaihlihsapuz panha’an Taitu’.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Kaca’anin Taitu’ a, ma’unting laihlih ca pantamaun naak munha’an ul’uanlaihlih anpasduu zamun.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，我的叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Nii’ tu daqvisan is ul’uanlaihlih ca lumaq it pantamaun naak, pudaan tukuc is laihlih a kaca’anin ta’.
S.TRANSL: 車站離我叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Maiza ca madaing sala ka sasaipukas sinaipuk ingalan lumaq it pantamaun naak, muskun azam tunpaqais munha’an sasaipukan.
S.TRANSL: 我叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: Uutu ha’an sasaipukan, adasun azam pantamaun naak paka’un sidi ciin tancikis.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Sanavanin, muskun azam munmicqang’acang ma’un qaisang.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Madia’ sala ca laihlih ha’an micqang’acang, daqat tunpaupuh azam maipata’.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Na mudaanin azam a, malulun tu munghav tanqa’iu’us bunun ca paupuh, daqat mu’hazin azam tunlaihlihqaungu’ mucuqais.
S.TRANSL: 要回去的時候，發現摩托車被人偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Kaha’anin azam Taihuku’ haip, niapang ti inku’ananin naupa ca paupuh kit pantamaun naak.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道我叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Iha’an Ququaz ca lumaq naam tu takiucang, masipulin a mulusqu munha’an Qabinaz, ua’ takaha’anin bukzav miqumic.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在曲冰，上學以後，就搬到了埔里，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Qabinaz. After I started school, we moved to Puli and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Masipulin is sipulandaing, masipulak is itu iniqumicas Bununcuku’ a sipulun, minqanciap tu maca Bununcuku’ ha’an Taivang ti’ a madia’ sala ca vaivivaivi ka iniqumican.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Daqat, iha’an haip qamisan tu tanabal dii, muskun azak it tuqasnanaz mun’acang macicingav is madadaingaz, asat maqanciap is inak’anak a iniqumican.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Punmavaau’unin qamisan ca madaingaz dii, uutu maupang is talnaqtungin a bunun saduu’an.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Pacingvan zaku ka cia tu ma’az ca qalinga qancaipun bazbaz, mantan a cia maqancia bazbaz is malasqai’ial, maqanciap amin bazbaz is malastauluu ciin malaspuut.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的日本話說得很流利，也會說國語和閩南話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Japanese, as well as Atayal, Hokkien and Chinese.

S.FORM: Macingavak cia ha maqanciapin tu, tauluu ca binanau’az cia, madia’ sala ca puut pacqalan ha’an kukuza’an cia, daqat madia’ ca qalingaz qancaipun cia bazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是漢人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Chinese, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Uutu pacingavan zami tudiip a, palaqanciap ca madaingaz diis madia’ sala ka itu qabas palaciat qanup a taiklac.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Altupat nii’ tu aminun macqal tu tukukua ca sinbabazbaz, Uutu kuci’aun zami tingvatikic pinqaningu, na maqtu’ang sicqasun tan’a.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Uutu takiucang azak nii’ang macqal is inak’anak a iniqumican, maz’av tukuc dii bununcuku’ ca siduq inaak amin.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Tudiipin tu minmadia’in ca sinpacqalan, mina’is’ang maqanciap tu maca inakan inaak Bununi’ a mantan makanvaivi, maqtu’ang iskukuniv.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為布農族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Haip qani’an tu na minsanavan, na mulumaqin ca nauba’nanaz.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: Muskun azak it qudasnau’az munca’an icivaa’ mabaliv is tulkuk, palasanuc is mantan macial a paitu sanavan na ispaka’un nauba’nanaz.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Laqai’ azam is babalivansanglav a, madia’ sala ca macicial a sanglav ha’an balivansanglav.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Mabaliv azam is sanglavkabuu’, tankaunu ciin tau’lacdangqac.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Maca ingalan taimicia babalivas kukutdaqun tupa’ tu, “mantan madavuc ca unglai ciin qalup inaak, mabaliva tukuc!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Mabaliv azam is unglai ciin qalup.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Laqai’ azam babalivas qasu’, tupa ca taimicia tu, “ma’az ca balivun su’u? masqa’ masimal amin ca tulkuk haip, taau saba cuii ca ta’a.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Tan’aun qudasnau’az tu mantan maqlic sala, ua’ macingav is taimicia tu maqtu’ang naupa vanaqan tukuc.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Uutu tupa ca taimicia tu naut nii’in dangpia ta’ cuii, nii’in maqtu’ vanaqan.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Bazbaz ca ingalan a taimicia tu, nuqan mabaliv is kaan inaak i’, mamasqa’ ca kaan naak nii’ amin tu maqlic.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Mabalivin azam is tulkuk ciin kaan tu hiku’in, mulumaq mahanat is tatpangka’ a ququul.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Malabuntu matatala ha, mindumdumin ca diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Katingva’ ca nauba’nanaz mulumaq taqu tu, minkava’ nii’ tu maqtu’pul’uun ca malalasti’, maca ha’anin muqnin inul’uan na mulumaqin.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Tupa kat qudasnau’az tu na palcikaupata’in is sinpitdia ki’ a, amini luklac ca mangka’ na muskun ma’un!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: Luklac azam is kitlumaq, kaviaz, uskunan ma’us mantan macial sala kau’un a paitu sanavan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Maiza tatini ka tukuzaku, malabuntu ka cia minpungul is mama’az.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Qanciaz, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Tudiip maca masipul, simul a cia ispapatas, isqaqaisqais cina papatasan ha’an tukucia.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Maca muc’anang, mupusan, muti’un a, na pasilulanang is duma’ a cia mama’az.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Uutu, maiza ca madikla’a talmaupa’an cia, malabuntu sisimul is mama’az a nii’ tu macuqais.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Ihiku’in a nii’in ca duma’ asa pasimul cia mama’az.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Maiza tatdiqanin, muskun azam mudadaan kavivila’.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: Panmicqang is daan a, si’a’auma kat Qanciaz, uutu minpungul a cia madas is haqailqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Qanciaz想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Qanciaz wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: Makus’aiv a cia haqailqaisqais ha’an tukucia, uutu mu’amin ca duma’ antalam tupa tu, nii’ azam amin madas.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: Tangic at Qanciaz dii nii’in maqanciap tu na masikua. Mahau’ a cia tupa tu, makua amuu cuna mu’amin nii’ tu pasimul zakun is haqailqaisqais!
S.TRANSL: Qanciaz不知所措就哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼你們都不借我衛生紙!
Qanciaz burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: Taqu’an tukucia kat cia tu, nii’ asuu anak’anak andas’andas, maupa amin tu, na ispasimul su’un ca mama’az a, nii’ asu lungulungu macuqais!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Muqnin masipul tu lakbingin, kantingmut sala kat Qanciaz munsipulan, aminun Qanciaz ca sinimul cia ka mama’az macuqais iscaiv is tukucia.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Qanciaz很早就到學校了，Qanciaz把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Qanciaz arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Sumsumun Qanciaz ca tukucia, tupa amin tu na anak’anakin a cia madas is mama’az, masumsum amin is tukucia dii mina’is’ang pasimul cias mama’az tu tangausang.
S.TRANSL: Qanciaz向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Qanciaz apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: Numu’ malkaqanup at tama naak ha’an acang.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Uutu uva’azang azak, na sanavan at tama ciin pantamaun munata’, madas is viia’ ciin bucul.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Uuca mincingqalin ca diqanin, na madas a nai pinanaq a mama’az mucuqais.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Mintung ciat vanis, mintung ciat haval, na mintun maiza amin ca linas.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: Iha’an a nai acang picial pavaz is sinpapanak, sisulavis duma’ a bunun.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Malabuntu azak pinqalisual it tama, na asat malavi tama tinqanup.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Tupa kat tama tu, maca taldaingin azak ka na dasun cia azak muskun maipata’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Maqanciap amin makuhaqu madamus tismumuut ca taka’acang a bananaz, maqanciap a nai matas’is haquduun ciin malaqatu’.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Mantan at tama naak maqanciap matas’is haquduun, tupa kat tama tu, isdamus linas ca dii, asat macqas saduu dapan is mama’az, na picanun daan laqaibas mama’azi’ ca haqu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Tis’unin na mahiav muskun is madadaingaz tinqanup, daqdaqanin azak pisqanciap mahaqu, tuza’ tu maqtu’ madamus mama’az ca haqu naak.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Saduu’an tama naak a tupa zakun tu, na zaku dau qabasin ca mantan matamasaz a malaqanup tu bunun.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說，我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Taldaingin azak haip, ama’un zaku ca inaak a buculkaka ciin kuus, malavit tama muskun tinqanup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Matu mucuqaisin a nai mun’acang a isulavis duma’ taka’acang bunun ca sinpapanaq a mama’az.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Tupa kat tama tu, asat masumsumtas maitangusin a madadaingaz macaiv is bahi’, maqtu’ang pasiza’un itun ca malcikaupa ta’ a mama’az.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Sihalacan azak munha’an sipulan tu tingmut.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Minpungul azak madas kavang tu, munha’an sipulan.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Nii’ azak madas lungulungu mama’az.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Muskun azak tukuzaku saduu haqailsipulun tu, masipul.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Pasimulan azak tukuzaku ispapatas ciin isqaqaisqais tu, patanam.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Bazbaz zakun ca tataqu tu, “tingmuta mindangkaz ca muqnin, ka’in tu sihalacan!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Kaviaz daingaz inaak tupa’un tu Tanpilic, Uva’az amin a cias Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Tanpilic，他也是布農族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Tanpilic, and he is also an Bunun child.

S.FORM: Muskun azam iha’an Ququaz masipul.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在曲冰部落讀書。
We study together in the Ququaz tribe.

S.FORM: Malucbut azam muskun tan’as madadaingaz bazbaz is qaiqabasan tu qalinga, mu’amin azam maqanciap malasbunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.

S.FORM: Malaungkav azak a masmuq amin, maputis at Tanpilic a makuis amin.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Tanpilic很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Tanpilic is short and thin.

S.FORM: Mina’ia’ang sala kat Tanpilic ca mankama’az, asaun salas duma’ a miniqumic.
S.TRANSL: Tanpilic很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Tanpilic is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Kavivila’ paluntan ca sipulan haip diqanin, madia’ sala ca sinkanal is sipulan a paluntanun.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Maiza ca pasibutbut, katundaqmali’, malilia, iungi’ ciin manaq buculkaka.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: Paluntan azak malilia.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Laplaq azak tu malilia tudiip, milu’lu’ ca qaa’, madia’ sala ca tiquc.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Qaltu mindangkaz azak muqnang malilia.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來繼續跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Pandiipin azak a mu’amin ca bunun manahip sala.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Qaltu nii’ tu lavai’, uutu mantan azak manahip sala, maupa’i saunaqtungan zaku ca paluntan dii.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Muskun azak tama tantungu ha’an pantamaun naak takna.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Milu’lu’ ca bantac it pantamaun naak.
S.TRANSL: 我叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Taqu’an cia azam tu mutuszuq ca tatavis lumaq.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Minaca’an a cia tatavi muqalqal tu sikangna ka cias tatavi.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Madas at tamas qasu’qanvang ciin saviki’ iscaiv it pantamaun naak.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給我的叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Muskun azak it pantamaun naak iha’an sabaqan pababazbaz, taqu ka cia madia’ sala ka qaiqabasan tu qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我和我的叔叔在房間裡聊天，他講了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: Tantangaus is na mudaanak, matumacqaing zakun at pantamaun tu taldaingin, mintalminduu amin.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Tupa azak tu, “Tamanama’, mul’uang maca mincialin ca bantac, na munca’an amin lumaq naam kavivila’ ca ickuinin.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: Iha’an 2022 qamisan, mun’anpuk ca sasbinaz palaqanciap is itu Bununcuku’i’ a cibunsiu’ tu maqtu’ hazun palasbununun papatas is ngaan.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Maicingavak is mintalminduu ka bunun inita acang Nasing Balincinan, punpipiin pundaza’ is paitasan na asa dau hazun palasbununun papatas ca ngaan ha’an cibunsiu’.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年人Nasing Balincinan。
I interviewed Nasing Balincinan, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: Patataqun azak icia tu na munha’an lumaq cia tantungu maca ha’an inul’uan dii.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Ha’an sinpacingav dii ha, papacqal zakun a cia tu mina’ica ca ngaan icia dii, madas amin zakun papacqal is kitlumaq icia, acang icia.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Pacingavun zaku tu mazang siqucal tuza’ pahuvaiv is ngaan, nii’ tu macial ca maupa qabas a’ papatas?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Tupa ka cia zakun tu, maupa’i maca malastauluu papatas a, nii’ tu mamantu ca sinpatungaan a qaquang cia, mintun amin ca duma’ bunun luklac cia tu “那先生”, Daqat mupiin paqainanan salas duma’.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Na Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Tupa kat Nasing tu, “ciat malasbunun papatas is ngaan ca nanu’ ngaan inita’, maca ngaan inita’ i’ a nanu’ sinpasnava’ is siduq nita’, kitlumaq inita’, ainakan nita’ ti cima, min’asaz tu katnuang minmadia’ ca Bununi’ mucuqais kilim is inak’anak a ngaan.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Nasing said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Muskunak qudasnau’az takna munca’an pu’inunas isbabaliv malkaciat langqa’babalivan, madas at qudasnau’az is inak’anak cia sincuaz a sanglavsanglav, matas’i ka cia amin is itu Bununcuku’ kakaunun na balivus miniqumic.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食買給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Asaun salas bunun ca langqa’babalivan it qudasnau’az, madia’ sala ca bunun mabaliv is daqpuut ciin pa’ic, madia’ sala ca bunun tanam ma’us sinhanat icia ka ququul.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Mantan macial sala kaunun ca sinhanat icia ka li’li’ ciin dulazqaising, maiza amin ca kuci’aun maqav sinpisumal a qasu’vanis, madia’ sala ca bunun kaidaas tahun cia, mu’amin ca bunun munha’an langqa’babalivan icia masinlautu.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Uuca mahanat ca qudasnau’az is mama’az a, na ingalanak malkaciat taitungu, ingalanak sidaing is qalinga luklac tu, “mu’amin inak’anak sincuaz ca sanglavsanglav, nii’ tu punda’as iuu’, haiva maipa dii mabaliv.”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: Mahiav sala ca mama’az naam aminun isbaliv, tupa ka qudasnau’az tu, “ala nii’ang it maizakas ha’an ti’ kadangazi’.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: Maca sinkukuza dii ha, uqancaipanak is itu Bununcuku’ a taiklac is mutmuut ciin kakaunun, tan’a amin sinangu’an is malkaciat langqa’babalivan mangki’.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: Saduu qudasnau’az tu mantan asa salas nanu’ talmaupa’an a kakaunun, kanaha’an azak is is’ang tan’a tu mantan ac kini’ kakunivun ciin kabahi’un sala.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，這令我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
